How Elon's Grokipedia holds up against Wikipedia
description: Behind the hype lies an ambition larger than just rewriting the internet’s encyclopaedia: Musk wants to challenge who gets to define truth. Grokipedia, built by Musk’s xAI team and powered by its Grok large language model, is positioned as a “less biased” alternative to the “venerable” Wikipedia. Of course, in Musk-world, “less biased” translates loosely to “more aligned with Elon’s worldview.” Not that Wikipedia isn’t biased — and in particular topics, is left of Fidel Castro.

description: According to the Gallup National Health and Well-Being Index, America’s adult obesity rate has fallen to 37% in 2025, down from 39.9% in 2022 — a small but significant drop after decades of stagnation. Over the same period, the number of people taking injectable anti-obesity drugs more than doubled, from 5.8% to 12.4%. Coincidence? Perhaps. But correlation has rarely looked this convincing.

title: Air India Express unveils new cabin interiors and expands winter operations
5 stories you must read today, October 28: From Mehli Mistry’s removal from Tata Trusts to artificial rain in Delhi and more
Japan’s mysterious ghost plants reveal how life survives and grows in darkness
description: Japanese botanist Kenji Suetsugu's childhood fascination with ghost flowers led to a career uncovering their secrets. These unique mycoheterotrophic plants survive without photosynthesis by parasitizing fungi, challenging biological norms. Suetsugu's research revealed their reliance on camel crickets for seed dispersal and tiny insects for pollination, even discovering new species and a rare plant genus.

Delhi Police arrests espionage suspect; 'links' with foreign nuclear agencies
description: Delhi Police arrested a 59-year-old man, Mohammad Adil Hussaini, for alleged espionage and running a fake passport racket from Jamshedpur. Officials said he and his brother Akhtar supplied sensitive information abroad and forged documents to obtain multiple passports. The network had links to Gulf nations and a foreign nuclear scientist, police said.

Cyclone Montha landfall: Path, affected states, wind speed - all your questions answered
description: Cyclone Montha, a severe cyclonic storm named by Thailand, is set to make landfall on India's east coast near Kakinada, Andhra Pradesh, on the evening of October 28, 2025. The storm, with sustained winds of 90-110 km/h, will bring heavy rainfall and strong winds to coastal Andhra Pradesh and Odisha, with potential impacts extending to neighboring states.

title: Shreyas Iyer out of danger, recovering 'faster than expected'; shifted out of ICU
description: Indian batter Shreyas Iyer is recovering remarkably well from a spleen injury, exceeding medical expectations. He has been moved out of the ICU and is reportedly in good spirits. Meanwhile, India's women's opener Pratika Rawal faces a four to six-month layoff due to a knee injury, with Shafali Verma named as her replacement.

description: Pacer Mohammed Shami's recent bowling form has put him back in contention for selection.  His strong performances in the Ranji Trophy have silenced doubts about his fitness.  This follows a public disagreement with selection committee chairman Ajit Agarkar.  Shami's wickets have sent a clear message to selectors ahead of the South Africa tour.

description: Russia claims a successful test of its nuclear-powered cruise missile, Burevestnik, boasting limitless range and stealth. This development revives interest in nuclear air propulsion, a Cold War concept abandoned due to safety and technical hurdles. While its invincibility is debated, the missile's potential impact on arms control and future space exploration is significant.

title: Bihar polls: Chirag Paswan backs Nitish as NDA's CM face; clarifies Shah's remark
description: Union minister Chirag Paswan has affirmed Nitish Kumar as the NDA's chief ministerial candidate for Bihar polls, echoing Amit Shah's stance. Paswan criticised the INDIA bloc's projection of Tejashwi Yadav, linking it to past 'jungle raj' fears. Bihar will vote in two phases on November 6 and 11, with results to be declared on November 14.

His wife, Andrea Kesler, is reportedly standing by him amid the legal scrutiny.

description: The RJD-Congress-led Mahagathbandhan has unveiled its manifesto, "Bihar ka Tejashwi Prann," for the upcoming Bihar elections, promising significant changes. Key pledges include one government job per family within 20 days of forming the government, restoration of the Old Pension Scheme, and Rs 2,500 monthly for women under the Mai-Behin Maan Yojana, alongside 200 units of free electricity.

Shami also commented on media scrutiny and social media perceptions.

description: The BJP criticised former Delhi CM Kejriwal for his alleged failure to address the city's pollution crisis, citing issues with the Yamuna River and air quality. Energy security push! India plans 10% mandatory LNG extra reserve
description: India plans to mandate LNG import terminals to build 10% extra storage for government access during supply or price disruptions. This aims to create cost-effective emergency reserves using existing infrastructure, avoiding expensive new underground storage. The proposal also outlines financial and operational criteria for new terminal operators.

description: Central government employees have reason to celebrate as the Union Cabinet approved the Terms of Reference for the 8th Pay Commission. This temporary body will review salaries and benefits, with recommendations expected within 18 months, aiming for implementation by January 1, 2026.

Satish Shah's real cause of death revealed: Co-star says it wasn't kidney failure
description: Veteran actor Satish Shah, known for 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', has passed away at 74. Contrary to initial reports of kidney failure, co-star Rajesh Kumar clarified that a sudden heart attack was the cause. Shah was reportedly at home having lunch when the tragic incident occurred. The industry mourned his loss at a prayer meet.

title: Do you really need a 4K screen? This is what science says
ChatGPT Go subscription now free: Offer starts November 4; Who are eligible users
description: OpenAI is making its ChatGPT Go subscription free for all Indian users for a year, starting November 4. This strategic move targets India, the company's second-largest and fastest-growing market, in response to aggressive user acquisition by rivals Google and Perplexity.

title: 30,000 layoffs at Amazon: Managers receive email; HR division faces deepest cuts
description: Amazon initiated urgent manager training on October 27, preceding notifications to up to 30,000 corporate employees about layoffs starting the next day. These cuts, impacting nearly 10% of its corporate workforce across various divisions, represent the company's largest job reduction. The move comes amid aggressive cost-cutting and significant AI investments, with a strict return-to-office policy failing to reduce staff voluntarily.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in fire-red at Chiefs MNF, steals Patrick’s spotlight
description: Brittany Mahomes is making a significant impact this NFL season, both with her bold fashion choices and her community involvement.  She recently wowed fans with a striking fire-red leather outfit, showcasing her growing influence beyond her husband Patrick's football career.  Together, the couple continues to give back to Kansas City through their foundation and sports team ownership.

title: Delhi horror: How racy clips, rekindled romance led to murder; forensic grad scripted fiery cover-up
description: In a tale of passion turned peril, Ramkesh Meena and Amrita Chauhan found their love story interrupted by the shadow of Amrita's former flame, Sumit Kashyap. When intimate footage emerged, a desperate attempt to reclaim control spiraled into chaos with a botched robbery that ended in tragedy for Ramkesh.
